Class shared_spin_mutex

boost::sync::shared_spin_mutex

Synopsis

// In header: <boost/sync/mutexes/shared_spin_mutex.hpp>


class shared_spin_mutex {
public:
  // construct/copy/destruct
  shared_spin_mutex() noexcept;
  shared_spin_mutex(mutex const &) = delete;
  shared_spin_mutex & operator=(mutex const &) = delete;
  ~shared_spin_mutex();

  // public member functions
  void lock() noexcept;
  bool try_lock() noexcept;
  void unlock() noexcept;
  void lock_shared() noexcept;
  bool try_lock() noexcept;
  void unlock_shared() noexcept;
};

Description

shared_spin_mutex public construct/copy/destruct

  1. shared_spin_mutex() noexcept;
    Default constructor.

    Creates a mutual exclusion primitive in the unlocked state. 

  2. shared_spin_mutex(mutex const &) = delete;
  3. shared_spin_mutex & operator=(mutex const &) = delete;
  4. ~shared_spin_mutex();
    Destructor.

    Destroys the mutual exclusion primitive.

    Requires:

    The primitive is in the unlocked state.

shared_spin_mutex public member functions

  1. void lock() noexcept;
    Exclusively locks the mutex.

    If the mutex is not locked, the method acquires an exclusive lock and returns. Otherwise the method blocks until the mutex is unlocked. 

  2. bool try_lock() noexcept;
    Attempts to exclusively lock the mutex.

    If the mutex is not locked, the method acquires an exclusive lock and returns true. Otherwise the method returns false. 

  3. void unlock() noexcept;
    Unlocks the mutex.

    Releases the mutex that has been exclusively locked by the current thread.

    Requires:

    The mutex is exclusively locked by the current thread. 

  4. void lock_shared() noexcept;
    Shared locks the mutex.

    If the mutex is not exclusively locked or shared locked, the method acquires a shared lock and returns. Otherwise the method blocks until the mutex is unlocked. 

  5. bool try_lock() noexcept;
    Attempts to exclusively lock the mutex.

    If the mutex is not exclusively locked or shared locked, the method acquires a shared lock and returns true. Otherwise the method returns false. 

  6. void unlock_shared() noexcept;
    Unlocks the mutex.

    Releases the mutex that has been shared locked by the current thread.

    Requires:

    The mutex is shared locked by the current thread.
